alert.note: Alert for Tallapoosa (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 16 at 1:02PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Tallapoosa County through 145 PM CDT... At 101 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Jacksons` Gap, or near Dadeville, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Dadeville, Jacksons` Gap, New Site, Goldville, Northern Lake Martin, Daviston, Eagle Creek, Horseshoe Bend and Horseshoe Bend National Military Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
